definition: to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity

sentences.english: We have got into trouble here, I say we bail.
sentences.chinese: 我们闯祸了，我说咱们开溜吧。

sentences.english: The drivers who habitually cut in will cause an accident sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 那些总爱抢道的司机总有一天会闯祸。

sentences.english: If you get into trouble again, you'll be expelled .
sentences.chinese: 如果你再闯祸就会被开除的。

sentences.english: I'll be as prim as I can and not get into any scrapes , if I can help it.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽量板着面孔，不去闯祸，如果我能做到的话。

sentences.english: Mufasa:Being brave doesn't mean you go looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 《狮子王》“勇敢并不代表你要四处闯祸。”

sentences.english: In 1, he kept making mistakes, angered the father scolded him look fierce and talk boisterously.
sentences.chinese: 他不停闯祸犯错，惹得父亲疾言厉色地责骂他。

sentences.english: He is an impudent boy and always gets in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他是个鲁莽的男孩，经常会闯祸。

sentences.english: We knew that a kid who collected junk had little time to get into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，拾垃圾的小人没有多少时间闯祸。

sentences.english: The heedless boy was always getting into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 这个粗心大意的男孩总是闯祸。

sentences.english: This had happened many times since he left school.
sentences.chinese: 自从他离开学校后他经常闯祸。

definition: to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to stir up trouble
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
naughty/mischievous/to act up
to cause trouble
to make a mess of sth
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
naughty/mischievous
confused/mixed up/muddled up/befuddled
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
stubborn and obstreperous/naughty and mischievous
to discipline/to teach/to guarantee
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
